critique: This document is an executive order that amends a previous executive order related to the Career Compensation Act of 1949. It extends the regulations prescribed by the President under section 302 of the Act until January 31, 1951. Given the subject matter, the document has little bearing on ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, or social inclusion. It primarily concerns economic regulation in the context of career compensation, but the impact is minimal. Therefore, most scores will be neutral.
